title: The.100.Season01
description:
The.100.Season1.DVDrip.576p.x265.HEVC.OPUS.mkv

DVDrip encoded from ISO-copy, using video encoder x265 (HEVC), 
and OPUS as audio encoder. 
The visual and audiable quality is superb!
Overall, the total visual and audiable quality loss is less than 
5 percentage, compared to the original DVD. 

Languages: 
 - Audio: 	English, Spanish
 - Subtitles:	English, Danish, Finnish, Norwegian, Spanish, Swedish

IMDb link:  <a href=" http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2661044" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2661044</a>
IMDb rating: 7,5
Genre:	     Drama, Sci-Fi
Creator:     Jason Rothenberg
Stars:	     Eliza Taylor, Eli Goree, Thomas McDonell
Storyline: 
  Set 97 years after a nuclear war has destroyed civilization, when a
  spaceship housing humanity's lone survivors sends 100 juvenile 
  delinquents back to Earth in hopes of possibly re-populating the planet.

---

20 files included:
 * Season 1: 13 episodes in English 6 channels and Spanish 2 channels.
   - Episode 13 includes an extra English audio commentary track.
 * Text file with extended information regarding the files.
 * DVD extra material, 6 extra files, total 41min 41sec.
   - The 100 - 2013 Comic-Con Panel, 13min 29sec
   - Deleted scene episode 13, 2min 2sec
   + Creating the World of The 100:
       - In the beginning, 6min 55sec
       - The Ark, 6min 20sec
       - A New Earth, 6min 30sec
       - Grounders, Reapers, and Mountain Men, 7min 33sec

Please note that not all media players can play MKV files with OPUS 
as the audio format. The only reason for encoding in OPUS is that I 
wanted to reduce the overall file sizes as much as possible, but 
not diminish the audio quality more than a few percentages. 
Encoding in OPUS reduced the AC3 audio file sizes with 15% for 
Spanish 2 channels audio, and by 30% for English 6 channel audio. 

I've only tested these files on a Windows machine, but it should work with 
any mediaplayer which has support for OPUS, x265/HEVC and MKV-format.

I've played the MKV-files successfully on a Windows-PC, with the following 
media players:
* Light Alloy ver 4.8.6, or newer.
* MPC-HC (Media Player Classic - Home Cinema) ver 1.7.7, or newer.
* VLC ver 2.2.0 RC1, or newer.
* Zoom Player ver 8.5, or newer

Video is encoded with x265 (HEVC) encoder, using Hybrid as GUI, 
and these x265-settings to maximize the video quality:
x265 --preset veryslow --input - --input-res 720x576 -fps 25 
--no-high-tier --no-open-gop --crf 18 --qpfile GENERATED_QP_FILE --aq mode 1

Audio is re-encoded with OPUS, from AC3, using foobar2000 as GUI, 
and these settings for maximizing the audio quality:
For English audio: 320 kbps VBR Variable Bit Rate, 6 channels.
For Spanish audio: 160 kbps VBR Variable Bit Rate, 2 channels.


Subtitles are the original VobSub-files from the DVD.
Languages:  English, Danish, Finnish, Norwegian, Spanish, Swedish
